Creating a Complex Query

StarTeam allows queries with multiple logical operators and allows you to use any number of conditions per logical operator. The NOT operator can precede any condition or combination of conditions joined by ANDs and ORs. Nodes farthest from the root are evaluated first and the root node is evaluated last.

To create a complex query:

  1. Select a folder from the folder hierarchy.

  2. Click a component tab.

  3. Do one of the following:

    • Right-click a column header on upper pane. Then select Queries from the context menu.

    • Select Filters > Queries from the component or context menu.

    The Queries dialog opens.

  4. Click New. The New Query dialog opens.

  5. Enter a name for your query in the Name text box.

  6. Do one of the following:

    • Select the Public check box to add this query to the project (and the server configuration), allowing anyone with the appropriate access rights to use it.

    • Clear the Public check box to make the query private – that is, available only to your user ID.

  7. By default, the first logical operator in the Query Tree is AND. If the first logical operator in your query should be OR, select the AND logical operator in the query tree; then click the AND->OR->NOT button. This changes an AND to an OR. Similarly, one more click changes the OR to a NOT. Keep clicking until the operator that appears is the one you want to use.

    8. It is best to use the condition or logical operation that will result in the fewest matches as the first condition or logical operation.

  8. Create a condition for the logical operator:

    1. Select a field from the Field drop-down list box, which includes the most common fields. To display every possible field in the list box, select the Show Advanced Fields check box.

    2. Select an operator from the Operator drop-down list.

    3. Enter a value in or select a value from the Value text or list box. This value will be compared with the value of the selected field for each available item.

  9. Click Add to place this condition in the Query Tree box.

  10. To add more conditions for this operator, repeat steps 8 and 9 for each additional condition. Then go to step 11.

  11. (Optional) To add another logical operator:

    1. In the tree, select an existing logical operator (one that should precede the new operator in the query and be its parent in the tree).

    2. Click the AND, OR, or NOT button.

    3. If the operator is AND or OR, repeat steps 8 through 9. If the operator is NOT, repeat step 10.

  12. (Optional) Repeat step 11 to add additional logical operators.

  13. (Optional) Click View as text to view the query in text format. Click OK to close this window.

  14. Click Save. The Queries dialog displays your query.

  15. If this is a public query, you may want to set access rights for it. See Granting Access Rights at the Component Level and Granting Access Rights for Specific Filters and Queries.

  16. Do one of the following:

    • Select the query from the Queries dialog and click Select to apply the query to the items in the upper pane.

    • Click Close to exit without applying your query.

Tips:  You can rearrange nodes in the query tree by dragging and dropping. Also, if you change your mind about the condition while creating your query, select the condition, then click Edit to modify it or Delete to eliminate it.
